meanings.definition: A sleeveless garment worn over a shirt.
meanings.sent1: She wore a red vest over her white shirt.
meanings.sent2: The lifeguard put on a bright orange vest before going on duty.
meanings.sent3: The penguin looked funny wearing a tiny vest over its feathers.
meanings.sent4: His honesty was like a protective vest, shielding him from deceit.
meanings.sent5: The bulletproof vest saved his life during the dangerous mission.

meanings.definition: To confer or bestow power, authority, property, etc.
meanings.sent1: The king decided to vest more authority in his trusted advisor.
meanings.sent2: The company will vest ownership of the property to the new owner.
meanings.sent3: It was as if the magical wand could vest anyone with extraordinary abilities.
meanings.sent4: The ancient artifact seemed to vest its holder with mysterious powers.
meanings.sent5: The ceremony will vest him with the title of knight in the kingdom.

meanings.definition: To invest or endow with some attribute or quality.
meanings.sent1: She wanted to vest her savings in a secure investment.
meanings.sent2: The teacher tried to vest confidence in her shy student.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret ingredient seemed to vest the dish with incredible flavor.
meanings.sent4: His words were able to vest hope in the hearts of the weary travelers.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes seemed to vest the painting with life-like realism.
